abstract: Amnesty International reports Abdul Basit, paraplegic death-row inmate in Pakistan, was not granted stay of execution by Supreme Court and is scheduled to be hanged; only remaining way to halt execution is pardon from Pres Mamnoon Hussain.
lead_paragraph: The inmate, Abdul Basit, 43, has been paralyzed from the waist down since contracting meningitis in prison in 2010.

headline.main: Pakistan: Supreme Court Declines to Block Execution of Paraplegic Inmate
headline.print_headline: Asia; Pakistan: Supreme Court Declines to Block Execution of Paraplegic Inmate

snippet: The inmate, Abdul Basit, 43, has been paralyzed from the waist down since contracting meningitis in prison in 2010.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
